definition: to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: I admire the Occupiers who are currently doing this. Gets attention.
sentences.chinese: 我很佩服正在做这些的占领者们。

sentences.english: The Occupiers offer free food, also provided by donors.
sentences.chinese: 占领者们提供的免费食品也是捐赠者给的。

sentences.english: The hobbits then muster a voluntary militia force in which they fight back the occupiers.
sentences.chinese: 霍比人于是聚集起了一支义勇军抵抗占领者。

sentences.english: But since then, contributions to the Occupy cause have quadrupled.
sentences.chinese: 但是随后，对占领者的捐款已经增加了四倍。

sentences.english: Anti-French rebellions emerge all over the country to disrupt the foreign occupiers.
sentences.chinese: 反法起义出现在全国各地扰乱外国占领者。
